reviewText: This isn't just a double pack of two David lynch films, or two films with a similar vibe.  This film pairing actually makes more sense than most because you stand a better chance of grasping what the often confusing plot of each one is by seeing them together.  The realization one comes to is that the theme Lynch has been bringing to many of his works, starting around the time of Twin Peaks, is a question: How do people deal with a reality so horrific they can't face it?  Anybody who says they can't figure out the plot of these films or other recent films of his should consider that question and then watch again.
